qas.question: What is the name of the muse carved on Chopin's tombstone?
How much did Chopin's funeral cost?
Chopin's sister Ludwika took his heart back to Warsaw preserved in what?
How much did Chopin's funeral and monument cost?
Who took Chopin's heart to Poland?
Who ended up with the 200 letters from Sand to Chopin?

context: Chopin's tombstone, featuring the muse of music, <a1_0>Euterpe<a1_0/>, weeping over a broken lyre, was designed and sculpted by <a0_0><a5_0>Clésinger<a0_0/>.<a5_0/> The expenses of the funeral and monument, amounting to <a2_0><a6_0>5,000 francs<a6_0/><a2_0/>, were covered by <a3_0><a7_0>Jane Stirling<a7_0/><a3_0/>, who also paid for the return of the composer's <a8_0>sister<a8_0/> Ludwika to Warsaw. Ludwika took Chopin's heart in an urn, preserved in <a4_0>alcohol<a4_0/>, back to Poland in 1850.[n 9] She also took a collection of two hundred letters from <a9_0>Sand<a9_0/> to Chopin; after 1851 these were returned to Sand, who seems to have destroyed them.
